intro: Guettarda steyermarkii f. latior, commonly known as the broad-leaved guettarda, is a flowering plant species native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
